link.synopsis: In this rarely seen anthology series, Emmy winner Barbara Stanwyck plays host and frequent star of the self-contained stories, which range in genre from edgy comedy to Westerns, soapy romances and courtroom dramas. This collection finds Stanwyck stepping into a range of juicy roles, including a lonely woman facing heart surgery, a crafty shoplifter on a covert mission and a divorcée turned mail-order bride.
link.title: synopsis
The Barbara Stanwyck Show: Vol. 1: Disc 1
The Barbara Stanwyck Show: Vol. 1: Disc 2
The Barbara Stanwyck Show: Vol. 1: Disc 3
Other Men's Women / The Purchase Price
The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2
The Golden Age of TV Drama
Appointment in Honduras / Escape to Burma: Double Feature
Man with a Camera: Complete Collection
Love and Pain and the Whole Damn Thing
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
The Strange Love of Martha Ivers
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
Doctor Who: Lost in Time: The William Hartnell Years
Doctor Who: The Keys of Marinus
Doctor Who: The Dalek Invasion of Earth
Doctor Who: The Tomb of the Cybermen

link.synopsis: Social misfit Gretchen Finkle (Courtney Davis) has spent high school falling for losers, and senior year isn't any different. But when she becomes obsessed with bad boy Ricky (John Merriman), Gretchen's mother is so concerned she sends her to an inpatient therapy clinic. Gretchen soon realizes she needs to go on her own personal journey to examine her life and the choices she's made in this poignant indie comedy from writer-director Steve Collins.
link.title: synopsis
Chamber of Horrors / The Brides of Fu Manchu
Off the Charts: The Song-Poem Story
American Masters: Willa Cather: The Road Is All
The Very Best of the Honeymooners
The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys

link.synopsis: Heartbroken Norman (Sami Loris) decides to end it all after getting dumped by yet another girlfriend. His plans go awry, however, when the people he hopes to end it with are held hostage by a pair of twisted filmmakers who produce movies about torture. Romantic comedy and horror blend in this genre-busting entry that finds Norman desperately fighting for life and hoping that his latest love, Jennifer (Manon Kahle), will come to his rescue.
link.title: synopsis
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
Vision: From the Life of Hildegard von Bingen

link.synopsis: Depressed that he has no wife or family, middle-aged doctor-comedian-writer Neil B. Shulman (who plays a version of himself), looks for love after a suicide attempt by convincing a theater student to co-star in a romantic film with him. But as his plan hits a few snags, he interviews various Americans for advice in this comedy. Shulman was a producer of the hit Michael J. Fox movie Doc Hollywood and wrote the book on which it was based.
link.title: synopsis
Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day

link.synopsis: When a homicidal madman begins slaying young women in the idyllic New England town of Manchvegas, it's up to a trio of cunning local freelance businesspeople known as M.O.S. -- the Manchvegas Outlaw Society -- to get to the bottom of the crime spree. Meanwhile, a band of hairy forest monsters also menaces the village. This delightfully wry, low-budget comedy  from director Charles Roxburgh stars Matt Farley, Marie Dellicker and Tom Scalzo.
link.title: synopsis
The Christmas Season Massacre / Satan Claus / Psycho Santa
Jack Frost 2: Revenge of the Mutant Killer Snowman
The Gore Gore Girls: Special Edition

title.regular: Monsters, Marriage, and Murder in Manchvegas

link.synopsis: For the first time in their illustrious careers, comedy icons Christopher Guest, Michael McKean and Harry Shearer, stars of the cult classic This Is Spinal Tap, appear on stage as themselves performing acoustic versions of their most beloved songs. Drawing from their Spinal Tap catalog and other collaborations such as A Mighty Wind, the talented trio delivers a memorable performance full of comically crafted tunes and sidesplitting surprises.
link.title: synopsis
Sunshine Superman: The Journey of Donovan
The White Stripes: Under Great White Northern Lights
Kansas: There's Know Place Like Home
Cork n' Bottle String Band: The Ken's Bar Story
Joan Baez: How Sweet the Sound
Jandek: Manhattan Tuesday: Afternoon of Insensitivity
Shawn Phillips: Living Contribution: Live at Kirstenbosch Gardens
Bryan Ferry: Dylanesque Live: The London Sessions
Todd Snider: The Devil You Know
Eliza Gilkyson: Live from Austin, Texas
Dar Williams: Live at Bearsville Theater
Joni Mitchell's The Fiddle and the Drum
Bruce Springsteen: We Shall Overcome: The Seeger Sessions
The Harry Smith Project: The Anthology of American Folk Music Revisited
Bert Jansch: Fresh as a Sweet Sunday Morning
Tom Russell: Hearts on the Line
Country Joe Band: Turned Up and Turned On
Retrospective: The Videos of Suzanne Vega
Bill Gaither Presents: Country Bluegrass Homecoming: Vol.2

link.synopsis: Unlike any live music documentary you've ever seen, this film is an exploration of one artist's creative process, as songwriter and musician Rosie Thomas performs with the likes of Sufjan Stevens and Denison Witmer. Reflecting Thomas's inward-looking persona, the performances here are intimate, spare and heartfelt. In addition to her musical guests, Thomas also trots out her stand-up comedy alter ego, the undeniably odd Sheila Saputo.
link.title: synopsis
All You Need Is Love: The Story of Popular Music
Bob Ross: The Joy of Painting: 3-Hour Workshop
The Cutting Edge: The Magic of Movie Editing
Mates of State: Two of Us
Red Hot Chili Peppers: The Last Gang in Town
Inside Nirvana: An Independent Critical Review
Making Music with Carter Beauford and Victor Wooten
Foo Fighters: Live at Wembley Stadium
Black Keys: Live at the Crystal Ballroom
The White Stripes: Under Great White Northern Lights
Daniel Lanois: Here Is What Is
Tom Verlaine & Jimmy Rip: Music for Experimental Film
Pat McGee Band: Vintage Stages Live
On Stage at World Cafe Live: Living Colour
On Stage at World Cafe Live: Rhett Miller
On Stage at World Cafe Live: Duncan Sheik
Live Earth: The Concerts for a Climate in Crisis
Bloodied but Unbowed: Bloodshot Records' Life in the Trenches
Korn: Live on the Other Side
Paper Rad: Taking Out the Trash / Faces in the Trash
Elvis Costello & Allen Toussaint: The River in Reverse
Pendragon: And Now Everybody to the Stage
The Red Hot Chili Peppers: Phenomenon

title.regular: All the Way from Michigan, Not Mars
title.short: All the Way from Michigan, Not Mars

link.synopsis: This kid-friendly comedy follows the misadventures of middle-aged middle school teacher John Martin, who unwittingly drinks from Florida's lost Fountain of Youth and thereafter falls prey to random transformations into a preteen version of himself. As Big John (Herb Edelman) tries to find a cure for his unusual affliction, he struggles to keep the true identity of Little John (Robbie Rist) a secret from suspicious co-workers and nosy neighbors.
link.title: synopsis
Big John, Little John: The Complete Series: Disc 1
Big John, Little John: The Complete Series: Disc 2
The New Adventures of Batman: The Complete Series
Best of The Best of the Electric Company
The Hardy Boys Nancy Drew Mysteries
The Best of The Electric Company
Challenge of the Super Friends: Attack of the Legion of Doom
Challenge of the Super Friends: United They Stand
Pink Panther Cartoon Collection: The Ant and the Aardvark
Shaun the Sheep: Little Sheep of Horrors
Shaun the Sheep: Sheep on the Loose
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 4
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Turtles Forever
Shaun the Sheep: Off the Baa!
Scooby-Doo and the Loch Ness Monster
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 3
Scooby-Doo and the Legend of the Phantosaur
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 5
Shaun the Sheep: Back in the Ba-a-th
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 1

title.regular: Big John, Little John: The Complete Series
title.short: Big John, Little John: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: The new liberalism of the post-Franco years provides the backdrop for this dark comedy centered on the experiences of three actresses (Candela Pea, Goya Toledo and Mar Flores) working in Spain's soft-core porn industry as the country emerges from years of repressive rule. Although each of the women comes from a different background, they all share the common experience of exploitation at the hands of an opportunist hiding behind the veil of art.
link.title: synopsis
Red Shoe Diaries: The Movie: Special Edition
De Que Se Rien Las Mujeres?
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: The Bushes and the Bin Ladens battle on national television with dueling series aimed at boosting their popularity with the masses in this animated musical satire with a cast of characters that includes Osama Bin Laden, Mullah Omar and Jenna Bush. While Bin Laden waffles on format, the Bushes come up with a surefire winner: "The George and Jenna Comedy Hour," where dancing crucifixes and patriotic hot pants are the order of the day.
link.title: synopsis
Alice in Acidland / Smoke and Flesh
The History Channel Presents: Julius Caesar's Rome
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Jamie Foxx: I Might Need Security
The Brady Bunch in the White House
The Men Who Stare at Goats
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush

link.synopsis: When a portly fellow dressed in red vinyl flees a rehab center's costume party and appears in the Cassidy family's house shortly after an unexplained flash of light in the sky, the family and the rest of the locals think he's an alien. Calling himself Zonad, the man (Simon Delaney) enjoys the fruits of his new celebrity -- until his fellow fugitive (David Pearse) arrives, claiming to be his superior officer, Bonad, in this comedy from Ireland.
link.title: synopsis
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
Arbuckle & Keaton: The Original Comique Paramount Shorts 1917-1920: Vol. 2

link.synopsis: With no job and no relationship -- and no prospects for either -- twentysomething Webster (Maclain Nelson) opts to start over. He heads to his childhood home and climbs up a tree, where he plans to stay the entire summer in a house of his own creation. Not surprisingly, Webster captures the attention of his neighbors, who soon find that they have a stake in his mission as well. Jacob and Michael Hamblin helm this quirky comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Assassination of a High School President
How to Be a Serial Killer
Anne of Green Gables: A New Beginning
Small Gauge Trauma: The Fantasia Film Festival
Rick Steves: European Travel Skills and Specials 2000-2009
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain

link.synopsis: When a 20-something new guy wanders into a ramshackle local saloon, the elderly barkeep and his best customer captivate the young man with outlandish stories of the neighborhood's glory days, which are quickly fading outside the old dive's doors. But as he gives ear to tall tales about a masked &NFi;lucha libre&NFi_; wrestler and other characters, the newcomer wonders if there isn't some truth in the geezers' wild fictions. Richard Sears directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: While vacationing in a small town, merciless Chicago art critic M.J. Clayton (Bronson Pinchot) makes a drunken bet that any moron can make art. But soon enough, M.J.'s foolish wager lands him in the town's art festival competition. With a little help from a gifted local painter (Toni Trucks), the talent-free M.J. must masquerade as a genuine artist in this charming independent comedy, shot on location in northern Michigan.
link.title: synopsis
How to Be a Serial Killer
The Best of Not the 9 O'Clock News

link.synopsis: In an effort to appease her nagging, nosy parents, schoolteacher Sarah Goldman (Robyn Cohen) must create the perfect boyfriend -- even if it means substituting her real beau with an actor (Tony Daly) who can play the part to the hilt. Lainie Kazan and Seymour Cassel portray the elder Goldmans, who are instrumental in helping the whole charade get completely out of hand in this bright romantic comedy from first-time director James Sherman.
link.title: synopsis
The Private Lives of Pippa Lee
Flying: Confessions of a Free Woman

link.synopsis: Eager to make a low-budget horror film, unemployed pot farmers Shark (Joe Glass) and Coltrane (Ivan Jones) saw off the arm of a cadaver to use as a prop, but their "half-baked" plan backfires when the zombie wants his arm back. Before long, our heroes are caught up in a trippy adventure with a gorgeous actress, a cadaver salesmen, cheerleaders with a secret, a cannibal redneck and a lusty dog in this stoner-centric horror comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this French animated comedy, best buds Tony (Vincent Cassel) and Jos (Izm) are happy getting by on the streets of the inner city with their scams and minor crimes, until Tony falls for wealthy hottie Clmence (Diane Kruger) and wants to go legit. Now Tony must change his life without losing his longtime friend. Emmanuel Klotz and Albert Pereira-Lazaro direct this film that also features the voices of Hafid F. Benamar and Delphynn.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
Pusher 3: I'm the Angel of Death
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!

link.synopsis: The classic clash of expectations between different generations of the same family gets a witty examination in this comedy from director Mark Tran, who wrote the screenplay as a 19-year-old San Jos State University student. Mr. Do (Chi Pham) -- an old-school Catholic Vietnamese father -- believes in raising his family his way. His American-born kids, however, think they should have some say in the matter.
link.title: synopsis
The 2006 Academy Award Short Films Collection
The King and Queen of Moonlight Bay

link.synopsis: To gain respect, new kid in school and terminal loser Namkoong Dahl (Tae-gyu Bong) picks a fight with the fiercest brute on campus, only to spend the rest of the day avoiding the inevitable after-school confrontation and brutal beating. Writer-director Seok-hoon Lee delivers classic comedy with action-packed Korean cinema flair as the nerdy hero engineers one desperate scenario after another to steer clear of his painful fate.
link.title: synopsis
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
Temptation of Eve: A Good Wife

link.synopsis: In this hip comedy, newly single Dean (John Meindersee) meets the lovely Angela (Leslie Picco) and soon moves in with her and her two roommates. Now he's at the end of his rope. But it's not living with three women that's driving him crazy -- it's his feelings for Angela. Bad advice from womanizing friends and crazy roommate antics aside, can Dean find his way out of bachelorhood and into Angela's heart?
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: Two people wounded in the dangerous dating war refuse to surrender in this comedy. With his confidence shaken after three years of rejection, Gary (Sasha Andreev) tries love with Lindsey (Keri Bunkers). Meanwhile, Sam (Emily Fradenburgh) has grown tired of waiting for her boyfriend to commit. Helped by buddies Eric (Eric Lee) and Roach (Andrew Kraft), Gary tries his luck again as Sam considers whether she can face being "on the market" once more.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: In this indie comedy about five twentysomething roommates in Los Angeles, slacker Shingo (Akie Kotabe) mixes up homemade Ecstasy to raise rent money, only to have timid fortune-cookie writer Murphy (David J. Lee) mistake the pills for his allergy meds. Meanwhile, career-driven Ellen (Samantha Quan) struggles with a rocky romance, self-destructive Akira (Jennifer Willison) acts out, and tech geek Trent (Baldeep Singh) just needs to get a life.
link.title: synopsis
Journey to the End of the Night

link.synopsis: Based on a hit web series, this Comedy Central sitcom presented from a first-person perspective follows the antics of a hard-partying single guy, his fame-hungry roommates and his two girlfriends, whom he has to keep secret from each other. Smashing the fourth wall as the main character addresses his audience, this unique show puts the viewer front and center for the hijinks. Michael Blaiklock, Sara Fletcher, Alexis Krause and Derek Miller star.
link.title: synopsis
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Funny World of Lucy: Vol. 2
Robot Chicken Star Wars: Episode II
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Amy Poehler
Family Guy: Something, Something, Something, Dark Side
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 3
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
Family Guy: Partial Terms of Endearment
Futurama: The Beast with a Billion Backs
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
The Jack Benny Show: Collector's Edition

link.synopsis: When talented young pianist Alessandro Corsini (Rosalino Cellamare) begins one-on-one lessons with a gorgeous new tutor, Laura Formenti (Carroll Baker), the adolescent lad begins to wish for one-on-one instructions of a completely different kind. Before long, Alessandro finds himself ushered into an exhilarating new world he once only fantasized about. This Italian coming-of-age comedy from director Vittorio De Sisti also features Leonora Fani.
link.title: synopsis
All the Colors of the Dark
Open Letter to the Evening News

link.synopsis: College student Steve (Jay Adaba) stumbles upon a wild topic for his senior thesis in New York's Washington Square Park when he discovers a culture of pick-up artists who prey on the ladies in broad daylight. Mentored  by a trio of alpha male "Park Sharks" -- Jared (Alexis Suarez), Ozzie (Donald Rizzo) and Louis (Nicolas Greco) -- Steve begins a chaotic journey and has an unexpected encounter with seductive lesbian pick-up artist (Pooja Kumar) in this dark indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: For anyone with tricky personal troubles -- marital, professional and otherwise -- Yu Guan (Guoli Zhang) and his buddies have a new business that will provide the solution, from taking the abuse of a man's nagging wife to showering an obscure writer with awards. Their plan is a hit, until it attracts the attention of government officials. This thoughtful comedy lends a revealing view into the early days of China's reform efforts in the 1980s.
link.title: synopsis
Operation Condor 2: Armour of the Gods

link.synopsis: When dim-witted Zhenya (Eugene Syty) winds up in Moscow with no money, a former engineer (Sergey Dreiden) takes him in. Soon Zhenya becomes caught up in the older man's whimsical attempts to protect his fellow citizens in this Russian comedy. These include relocating a public bench, painting his coat and adding fake genitalia to statues. Meanwhile, the engineer's daughter (Anna Mikhalkova) tries to inject reality into the quixotic situation.
link.title: synopsis
Shameless, Tasteless: Trash Cinema from the Soviet Underground
Alix Lambert's The Mark of Cain
Eugene Onegin: Classic Motion Picture with the Bolshoi Opera
Sleeping Beauty: Classic Motion Picture with the Kirov Ballet

link.synopsis: Finnish director Mika Kaurismki's lively comedy recounts the implosion of a modern marriage as family therapist Juhani (Hannu-Pekka Bjrkman) and his wife, Tuula (Elina Knihtil), attempt a civil break-up, yet instead generate anything but. While still living together, the duo mount competing conquests, and a cast of unhinged characters -- including Juhani's pimp brother (Antti Reini) -- turns the pair's home into a scene of high erotic farce.
link.title: synopsis
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
How Much Do You Love Me?
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: It's Friday at the Burger Shack, and waitress Natalie (Angela Trimbur) isn't having a good night. Her love life is a complete disaster, and her hapless co-workers and rude customers are about to push her over the edge. This bawdy comedy from first-time writer-directors Randy Van Dyke and David Edmundson is a tribute to anyone who's ever worked in the thankless food service industry and dealt with the patronizing public and lazy colleagues.
link.title: synopsis
Cock Sparrer: What You See Is What You Get

link.synopsis: Cantankerous matriarch Emma Blank (Marlies Heuer) is driving her household crazy with her imperious demands. Hoping to inherit her alleged fortune, her husband and daughter grudgingly act as her servants while waiting -- in vain -- for her to die. They rebel by taking lovers and acting as outrageously as Emma, but no one does loony quite like Emma in this sly black comedy from noted Dutch director Alex van Warmerdam.
link.title: synopsis
I Served the King of England
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro

title.regular: The Last Days of Emma Blank
title.short: The Last Days of Emma Blank

link.synopsis: Suddenly struck by the size of his wife's (Simona Babckov) nose, TV weatherman Oskar (Jir Machcek) realizes he's fallen out of love and tries to rediscover romance and excitement. While he pursues a string of entanglements, his long-suffering wife re-evaluates the meaning of joy. Oskar shares his conquests with the national media, but soon realizes that the more lovers he meets, the less love he feels. Jan Hrebejk directs this nuanced comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Served the King of England
Good Soldier Schweik 2: Beg to Report, Sir
Valerie and Her Week of Wonders

link.synopsis: Single and approaching 40, Clara (gata Roca) and her friend Manu (Paul Berrondo) decide to have a baby together. But when they spend time at a country house with Manu's pal Anders (Andres Herrera) and his longtime girlfriend (Vicenta Ndongo), relationships begin to shift. Meanwhile, they are playing out the events of a screenplay Anders is writing, and the line between fiction and reality is blurred. Cesc Gay directs this clever Spanish comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears

link.synopsis: With this ensemble comedy, director Christoph Schaub probes the complexities of age, and offers a charming and insightful meditation on the loss of youth and the challenges of growing old. Feeling neglected on her 15th birthday, Giulia (Corinna Harfouch) skips her own party to spend time with a perfect stranger. Meanwhile, Leonie (Christine Schorn) is forced to celebrate her 80th birthday at a depressing convalescent home.
link.title: synopsis
The Color of Your Socks:  A Year with Pipilotti Rist
Vision: From the Life of Hildegard von Bingen

link.synopsis: Filmmakers Massimo D'Anolfi and Martina Parenti craft a fascinating documentary that takes a hard look at entrepreneurship, business ethics and the global economy through the words and actions of three modern Italian businessmen. There's tense drama and bitter comedy in their efforts to establish a mineral water factory in Shanghai, China, as their Western beliefs and business models clash with a culture they can't comprehend.
link.title: synopsis
Saint John Bosco: Mission to Love
Paul VI: The Pope in the Tempest
The Black Belly of the Tarantula
All the Colors of the Dark
The Night of the Shooting Stars
Light the Fuse... Sartana Is Coming / I Am Sartana / Price of Death / Sartana in the Valley of Death

link.synopsis: Innovatively blending live action with hand-drawn backgrounds, this indie comedy follows the unusual saga of Murphy Grayson (Brian Wayne), long considered a revolting slob by every girl he meets. But thanks to a freak accident, his luck's about to change. Suddenly, women can read his thoughts, and after a few false starts, Murphy learns to channel his power into charming the pants off his sexual conquests.
link.title: synopsis
Rodney Dangerfield: No Respect: The Ultimate Collection
Avoid Eye Contact: Vol. 2: NYC Independent Animation
Liquid Tales: The Animated Films of Patrick Smith
Extreme Animation: Films by Phil Mulloy
Seth MacFarlane's Cavalcade of Cartoon Comedy: Uncensored
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters
Cut Up: The Films of Grant Munro
Avoid Eye Contact: Vol. 1: NYC Independent Animation
The Best of Zagreb Film: Be Careful / The Classic Collection
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call
Spike & Mike's Classic Festival of Animation
The Best of Zagreb Film: Laugh at Your Own Risk & For Children Only
Phantom Museums: The Short Films of the Quay Brothers

link.synopsis: Corbin Bernsen wrote, produced, directed and stars -- as Ben Corbin -- in this indie comedy about a seen-better-days actor who reinvents himself as the creator of a new media sensation that goes terribly, hilariously awry. When he finds Donna (Adrienne Frantz), a foulmouthed vixen who's as enigmatic as she is outspoken, he comes up with the idea to make her a webcam superstar -- as long as she'll sit still for it and he can keep the stalkers away.
link.title: synopsis
Fullmetal Alchemist: The Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa
Major League 3: Back to the Minors
Masters of Horror: Rob Schmidt: Right to Die
Jack Reed: One of Our Own
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail

link.synopsis: This double feature pairs a classic horror flick -- about a pathologist (Vincent Price) who experiments with a parasite that clings to the spinal cord of victims -- with a classic comedy about a professor (Tom Poston) who discovers the zotz, a coin with magical properties. William Castle, who directs both films, initially introduced The Tingler in theaters with electrically "enhanced" seats that delivered a mild shock to audience members.
link.title: synopsis
The Masque of the Red Death / The Premature Burial
The Tomb of Ligeia / An Evening of Edgar Allen Poe
The Fly 2: Return of the Fly
Mr. Sardonicus / The Old Dark House
Spine Tingler! The William Castle Story
House of Wax / The Mystery of the Wax Museum
The Invisible Man Returns / The Invisible Woman
Panic in Year Zero / The Last Man on Earth
The First Films of Samuel Fuller: The Baron of Arizona
The Giant Claw / The Creature from the Atom Brain
Tales of Terror / Twice Told Tales
The Oblong Box / Scream and Scream Again: Double Feature
The Masque of the Red Death
The Premature Burial / The Man with the X-Ray Eyes

link.synopsis: Lena (Marion Cotillard) and her sister Ariane (Julie Depardieu) are both single girls weary of looking for Mr. Right. At least Ariane's job writing captions for romantic photo stories gives her an outlet, as she uses her dreams for inspiration. But she's also idealized love beyond reality. When the perfect guy finally shows up, will either woman be prepared? Jonathan Zaccaï, Eric Berger and Chantal Lauby co-star in this knowing romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: After accidentally kissing unlucky aspiring singer Vicky (Aryeman Ramsay), ad agency publicity director Saba (Sayali Bhagat) discovers she's caught his bad luck; meanwhile, his music career takes off. Now Saba must track Vicky down in order to resurrect her charmed life. Complications arise when she falls for Vicky and a few other people begin trying to obtain the good luck kiss for themselves in this Bollywood romantic comedy
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A pair of ne'er-do-well con artists (Allari Naresh and Krishna Bhagavan) think they've pulled off the ultimate scam when they win the hearts of a pair of heiresses to a family fortune. But a suspicious banker sets out to spoil their big payday. Anyone familiar with the old Hope/Crosby "Road" pictures will immediately recognize what's going on in this sly music-and-dance-filled Bollywood update that mixes comedy, lush locales and gorgeous women.
link.title: synopsis
Sree Seetha Ramula Kalyanam Chutamu Raarandi

link.synopsis: Feeling stifled by the success of his wealthy wife (Sushmita Sen) and her control of their relationship, a businessman (Govinda) becomes involved with a supermodel (Lara Dutta). But when his wife suspects his infidelity, he pays a waiter (Ritesh Deshmukh) to pose as the model's boyfriend. The wife, meanwhile, hires a private investigator (Ranveer Shorey), an old friend who has always been in love with her, in this Bollywood comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Kyo Kii... Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Desperate for a place to live, twentysomething bachelors Parikshit (Aashish Chaudhary), Jayesh (Vatsal Seth), Parag (Javed Jaffrey) and Bhavesh (Shreyas Talpade) finally locate a house to rent, only to learn that the landlords will consider married applicants only. Frantic not to blow this chance, Parag and Bhavesh don dresses and pose as the wives of their two pals. Paritosh Painter directs this comedy that co-stars Johnny Lever.
link.title: synopsis
Dashavatar: Every Era Has a Hero
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: When independent twenty-something entrepreneur Charlotte Payne (Sophie Winkleman) joins an online dating service, she discovers that each query on a lengthy questionnaire leads her on an unusual voyage of self-discovery. Helped by pals Leslie (Collette Wolfe) and Jill (Smith Cho), Charlotte's comic adventures into her past may help her find the path to romantic bliss. This television comedy series also stars Christopher Moynihan and David Walton.
link.title: synopsis
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Funny World of Lucy: Vol. 2
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
The Jack Benny Show: Collector's Edition
The Daily Show with Jon Stewart: Indecision 2004
Triumph the Insult Comic Dog: Come Poop with Me

link.synopsis: After Nina (Amy Brienes) runs away from her wedding, her mother (Mara Cellario) marries the groom (Gabriel Vaughan) in her place and the two hit the road to search for the absentee bride. They soon become convinced that Nina has turned to crime in this zany comedy. Meanwhile, a pair of criminals in love (Eric Walton and Mandy Brown), a teenage boy (Zach Myers) on a joyride and a well-known radio personality (Matt Loney) wind up in the mix.
link.title: synopsis
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
Sex and the City: The Movie
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married

link.synopsis: While stumbling through a series of madcap adventures with fellow summer camp misfits Reckless (Scott Beaudin), Toast (David Gibson McLean) and Grandpa (Jesse Camacho), tiny preteen Fetus (Lucian Maisel) attempts to capture the affection of newly arrived knockout Sundae (Reva Timbers). Narrated by John Cusack and featuring an awesome 1980s soundtrack, this indie comedy offers viewers a joyous ride down memory lane.
link.title: synopsis
The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys

link.synopsis: When he learns that a co-worker is friends with his old high-school girlfriend, Jennifer (Claudia Ferri), stockbroker Gary (Pat Mastroianni) helps his former flame get a job at his company in order to pursue her affections all over again. But when Jennifer rejects his advances and dates other men, Gary becomes increasingly obsessed with winning her back. This offbeat comedy from director Simon Boisvert co-stars Diana Lewis and Bruce Dinsmore.
link.title: synopsis
Assassination of a High School President
Jayne Mansfield Collection: Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter?
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: Toy salesman Neil's (Martin Clunes) bachelor party gets wilder than expected when his supposed best friend Gary (Michael Praed) slips something into Neil's drink -- and the groom wakes up naked on a remote island. Now he embarks on a series of misadventures as he tries to get home. Meanwhile, back in London, Gary begins moving in on Neil's wealthy fiance, Hilary (Sarah Winman). Clunes also directed this zany British comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Franz Kafka's It's a Wonderful Life and Other Strange Tales
Doc Martin and the Legend of the Cloutie
The Most Fertile Man in Ireland
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them

link.synopsis: When the Russian (Jamie Uys) and American (Bob Courtney) delegates at a global peace conference can't compromise on a conflict, they find themselves tricked into settling the matter with a walking race from Athens to Paris -- and having hilarious misadventures along the way. Uys, known for his international smash hit The Gods Must Be Crazy, also produced, wrote and directed this zany South African comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Great African Films: Vol. 2: Sia, the Dream of the Python
Bab'Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul

link.synopsis: The girls at financially floundering St. Trinian's wind up at odds with each other over the outcome of the Gold Cup race -- some want a horse belonging to their classmate's Arab shiek father to win, while others try to sabotage his chances. Meanwhile, stern headmistress Millicent Fritton (Alastair Sim) and her bookie brother (also Sim) become involved. Inspired by the cartoons of Ronald Searle, this classic British comedy co-stars George Cole.
link.title: synopsis
The Pure Hell of St. Trinian's
The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore
Hammer Film Noir: A Stolen Face / Blackout
The Man in the White Suit
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember

link.synopsis: When he learns that his former client Grimshaw (Mervyn Johns) has escaped from prison and is planning to kill him, underhanded attorney William Fitch (Will Hay) fears that his chickens have finally come home to roost. But he's not ready to throw in the towel. Fitch teams up with his rival Claude Babbington (Claude Hulbert) to track down Grimshaw and bring him to justice. Hay co-directs this classic comedy with longtime collaborator Basil Dearden.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When her biological clock starts ticking, Lucie (Natalia Dontcheva) tells her lesbian lover, Marion (Vanessa Larr), that she wants a baby. Marion agrees, and the couple embarks on the delicate process of finding a suitable father -- eventually settling on Marion's old pal Hugo (Grgory Fitoussi). Lucie and Marion's unconventional path to pregnancy elicits a full range of reactions from their friends and family in this charming French comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Very Best of GLOW: Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling: Vol. 2
In the Arms of My Enemy
Otto; or, Up With Dead People

link.synopsis: While keeping his true identity and vast fortune a secret, billionaire Sam (Andy Lau) attempts to win the affections of sassy casino dealer Milan (Qi Shu). Meanwhile, Sam's trusty chauffer, Tim (Ka Wah Lam), and secretary, Jo (Denise Ho), try out new relationships with unexpected partners. Set on the island of Macau and directed by Wai-keung Lau, this sweet romantic comedy extols the value of following one's heart.
link.title: synopsis
Three Kingdoms: Resurrection of the Dragon
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage

link.synopsis: Looking to motivate his slacker employees, boat merchant C.J. Mason (Matthew Kaminsky) hires slick salesman Johnny Cross (Mel Fair). C.J. is elated when Johnny outsells everyone -- until he goes overboard and relies on trickery, extortion and threatening the staff to make sales. To regain control of the business and undo the damage Johnny has done, C.J. takes drastic measures in this wry indie comedy also starring Brooke Baumer.
link.title: synopsis
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes
Confessions of a Sociopathic Social Climber

link.synopsis: In the deep South, an eccentric accountant (Ray McKinnon) employs his remarkable math skills to help the O'Dell family escape their debts and save their troubled farm, concocting dubious schemes, exposing dark conspiracies and drinking loads of beer along the way. Winner of the 2001 Academy Award for Best Live Action Short Film, this quirky comedy also stars Eddie King, Walton Goggins and Gary Richardson.
link.title: synopsis
Drive by Truckers: The Dirty South
Homicide: Life on the Street: Season 3

link.synopsis: In this charming, colorful comedy set in the 1920s, Beatriz and Javier must pretend they're engaged to placate their pushy parents, even though they're just friends. Intrigue abounds as Javier dallies with a singer and Beatriz pursues a painter. Eventually, the pair succeeds in ending their engagement, but will they be able to live happily ever after with their paramours, or will they realize they're really in love with each other?
link.title: synopsis
Jeanne Dielman, 23 Quai du Commerce, 1080 Bruxelles
Sunshine Superman: The Journey of Donovan
Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
Coleccion Pedro Infante: La Mujer Que Yo Perdi
Coleccion Pedro Infante: A Toda Maquina
Coleccion Pedro Infante: La Oveja Negra
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Las Islas Marias

link.synopsis: After graduating high school, four rambunctious friends land in Seoul, where they establish themselves as fierce gangsters. But when other criminals claim a traitor is in their midst, the bad boys struggle to trust each other and unmask their enemy. Full of explosive action and gripping suspense, this Korean comedy about loyalty and friendship stars Jun-ho Heo, Chang-hun Lee, Jun Gyu Park and Won-jong Lee.
link.title: synopsis
Bushido: The Cruel Code of the Samurai
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: In this cynical twist on the shopworn romantic comedy genre, Brad (Damian Cecere) and Jenny (Jenny Hislop) meet in a bar and make a go of the whole love thing until bitter friends and jealous old flames step in to thwart the young lovers at every possible turn. It's a 21st-century "Sexual Perversity in Chicago" where romance hardly stands a chance in the face of the jaded, the wounded and the just plain mean.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: This offbeat buddy comedy tells the story of Jacques and Marc, two cops who not only can't stand each other, but also happen to be father and son, and who now must work side by side to free a friend from a band of outlaw bikers. Cracking the case depends on setting aside their long-held contempt for each other, as well as getting the bikers' conscience-stricken lawyer to rat out the vicious gang.
link.title: synopsis
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
The Dukes of Hazzard: Hazzard in Hollywood

link.synopsis: Vietnamese-American comedian Dat Phan, winner of "Last Comic Standing," performs a side-splitting stand-up routine in which he shares hilarious observations on hot-button topics, including racial stereotypes, American culture and relationships. Born in Saigon and raised in San Diego, Calif., the energetic Phan has toured all across America, using his culturally insightful brand of comedy to show audiences what's funny about heritage.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon Live: The International Show
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Jo Koy: Don't Make Him Angry
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Katt Williams: American Hustle: The Movie
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge
Penn & Teller: Off the Deep End
Comedy Jump Off: The Latino Connection
The Naked Trucker and T-Bones: Live at the Troubadour
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Zach Galifianakis: Live at the Purple Onion

link.synopsis: The director of Meat Weed Madness strikes again with this cult comedy that riffs on horror flicks, drug culture and modern life. Lord Meatweed's crazy clan hatches vendettas while combating terrorist Bin Smokin' and his exotic, erotic Jihotties. Jessie Bell attempts to reconcile with the northern branch of the Meatweed family but instead is corrupted with lots of sex and drugs, while Bullpucky takes matters into his own hands -- with meat hooks!
link.title: synopsis
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Rage Against the Machine: Live at the Grand Olympic Auditorium
Best of TromaDance Film Festival: Vol. 4
Film Crew: Wild Women of Wongo
Bam Margera Presents: Where the #$&% is Santa?
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day

link.synopsis: After Andy's (Andy Richter) accounting business fails to take off, a case of mistaken identity leads the talented number-cruncher to become a private investigator, who must routinely unravel baffling cases involving secret affairs, theft, blackmail and murder. Co-created by Conan O'Brien and Jonathan Groff, this off-the-wall comedy series also stars Tony Hale, Marshall Manesh, Harve Presnell and Clea Lewis.
link.title: synopsis
Andy Barker P.I.: The Complete Series: Disc 1
Andy Barker P.I.: The Complete Series: Disc 2
Andy Richter Controls the Universe: The Complete Series
Sam & Max Freelance Police: The Complete Series
Dorothy L. Sayers Mysteries: Gaudy Night
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
The New Adventures of Old Christine

title.regular: Andy Barker P.I.: The Complete Series
title.short: Andy Barker P.I.: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: Shenanigans reign supreme in China's imperial court when Royal Dog (Louis Koo), a bodyguard who would rather dream up outlandish inventions than practice his kung fu, uncovers a series of assassination plots revolving around the wicked court eunuch. As Royal Dog confronts a gender-bending killer and other murderers, he also becomes a reluctant suitor of the royal princess. Jing Wong directs this kung fu comedy that also stars Barbie Hsu.
link.title: synopsis
Fox Volant of the Snowy Mountain
Three Kingdoms: Resurrection of the Dragon
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman

link.synopsis: After their father's death, the histrionic Hernandez siblings organize an overblown weeklong wake in which they recount family stories, reignite old rivalries, reveal long-kept secrets and observe a laundry list of odd superstitions. A hilarious look at life, death and family ties, Filipino director Soxy Topacio's engaging indie comedy stars Roderick Paulate, Manilyn Reynes, Gina Alajar and Elizabeth Oropesa.
link.title: synopsis
Manila by Night: City After Dark
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko

link.synopsis: With the help of his childhood pal and fellow nighttime custodian, Tibi (Zsolt Trill), charismatic con man Gbor (Ervin Nagy) seeks out lonely women, charms his way into their lives and then helps himself to their life savings. But the jig may be up when the sexy swindler starts to fall for his latest mark, ballerina and wealthy heiress Hanna (Gabriella Hmori). Director Krisztina Goda helms this comedy that co-stars Sndor Csnyi.
link.title: synopsis
A Long Weekend in Pest and Buda

link.synopsis: Megastar Darling (Judy Ann Santos) leads a glamorous life, but something's missing. Meanwhile, her childhood friend, Biboy (Ogie Alcasid), searches for the homely girl he loved, and when he discovers Darling's true identity, he poses as her new female assistant to get close to her. The two soon form an intimate bond, and Biboy must decide if he's willing to reveal his identity and risk losing the woman he loves in this Filipino romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: In this Filipino romantic comedy, hospital patient Vince (Aga Muhlach) wakes up from his coma to catch a brief glimpse of a beautiful woman, Cristina (Regine Velasquez), scurrying out of his room. Naturally, he concludes that she's his guardian angel. When the pair bump into each other at shopping mall, Vince realizes that not only is Cristina real, but she just might be the girl he's been looking for his entire life.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Sonia Fry (Colleen Conley) suffers from chronic depression and insomnia, which is making it difficult to gear up for her first year at the University of Chicago. And her brother Billy (Tom Conley), a UCLA sophomore with some pretty major phobias, isn't much help. As the dysfunctional siblings get ready for school and learn to manage their disorders, they realize how much they need each other in this black comedy about the value of family.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play

link.synopsis: After one of Dr. Ravi's (Ravi Godse) patients commits suicide, supposedly due to his negligence, media outlets and the public begin vilifying him. As scrutiny into his life intensifies, Ravi struggles to protect his good name and maintain his grip on reality. An entertaining tale about a successful immigrant's battle for respect in America, this indie comedy co-stars Lisa Klein, Mark Thompson and Marlana Dunn.
link.title: synopsis
ESL: English as a Second Language
George Carlin: Life Is Worth Losing

title.regular: I'm a Schizophrenic and So Am I
title.short: I'm a Schizophrenic and So Am I

link.synopsis: Flat broke and facing eviction, aspiring movie actor Ford (Chris Fogleman) reluctantly agrees to help his freeloading roommate Tripp (William Gregory Lee) deal cocaine to supermodels, which unfortunately leads to big trouble with an extremely angry mafia boss. An amusing look at life in Hollywood, this hilarious buddy comedy also features Amber Benson, Ed Begley Jr., M.C. Gainey and Ezra Buzzington.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: It's a comedy of errors Bollywood-style as a pair of would-be hustlers, Veer and Prem, try to pull a financial fast one on Veer's step-brother and wind up in over their heads, which leads to mistaken identity, wife-swapping and a madcap farce. Soon, Veer's pretend wife, Vidya, and Prem's real one, Jhanvi, are at the center of the storm as they're forced by circumstance to switch identities. How soon until the con men's scam comes crashing down?
link.title: synopsis
Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy from India, Aditya is a workaholic earning his living at a finance company until he meets the free-spirited and beautiful Sheetal, and his attempts to convince her that he is no Casanova lead to an unlikely love affair. Soon they're married, and Sheetal must face the fact that Aditya isn't the well-heeled suitor she thought she'd landed. Further comic trouble ensues when they buy a house in a strict vegetarian community.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Dagur Kri directs this wry comedy that follows the intertwining stories of several Copenhagen residents, including charming graffiti artist Daniel (Jakob Cedergren), whose carefree days of underground painting end when his girlfriend (Tilly Scott Pedersen) becomes pregnant. Meanwhile, Daniel's geeky pal Morfar (Nicolas Bro) and a straitlaced judge (Morten Suurballe) each discover the pleasures of taking life less seriously.
link.title: synopsis
Pusher 3: I'm the Angel of Death
Pusher 2: With Blood on My Hands

link.synopsis: When her husband, Gerald (Ian Charleson), takes on a brazenly beautiful mistress in the form of a shiny, red sports car, bored housewife Jacqueline Spong (Julie Walters) quells a midlife crisis of her own by taking up with the salesman who sold the mister his new set of wheels. But Jacqueline's libido gets the best of her when she sneaks the car out for a joyride and gets caught red-handed. David Green directs this dark British comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life

link.synopsis: When an outrageously sexy new teacher (Michela Miti) joins the faculty of an Italian high school midway through the semester, slacker student and expert prankster Pierino (Alvaro Vitali) vows that he'll find a way to win her heart. But proud Pierino soon discovers that this instructor can school him in more ways than one. Marino Girolami directs this teen comedy that co-stars Enzo Liberti, Sofia Lombardo and Michele Gammino.
link.title: synopsis
Hanna D: The Girl From Vondel Park
Fatty Girl Goes to New York
The Virgo, The Taurus and The Capricorn
The Night of the Shooting Stars

link.synopsis: Depressed in the wake of a bad breakup, James Van Der Bexton (Hugh O'Conor) dives into the local speed-dating scene without much success. But when he turns his attentions to the lovely and mysterious Victoria (Olga Wehrly), danger and a surprise bout of amnesia ensue. The charming Irish comedy, which features a hip and eclectic soundtrack, also stars Emma Choy as a lovestruck nurse and Don Wycherley as a skeptical detective.
link.title: synopsis
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro

link.synopsis: Paranormal investigators Peter Venkman, Winston Zeddemore, Egon Spengler, and Ray Stantz  --  also known as the Ghostbusters  --  keep New York safe from ghoulish danger with the help of their old enemy Slimer in this installment of the animated hit. Adapted from the blockbuster 1984 comedy film, the hip cartoon series attracts fans young and old with smart stories, charismatic characters and impressive animation.
link.title: synopsis
The Real Ghostbusters: Creatures of the Night
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Original Series
Adventures of the Galaxy Rangers: Vol. 1
Adventures of the Gummi Bears: Vol. 1: Seasons 1-3
The Woody Woodpecker and Friends Classic Cartoon Collection: Vol. 2
Inspector Gadget: Go Go Gadget Collection
Adventures of the Galaxy Rangers: Vol. 2
The Best of She-Ra: Princess of Power
The Adventures of Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids
Adventures from the Book of Virtues
The Super Mario Bros. Super Show!
The Best of He-Man and the Masters of the Universe
He-Man and the Masters of the Universe (1983)

link.synopsis: Still smarting from a messy breakup with her latest beau, book editor Gwen Green (Andrea Roth) swears off love -- until she begins work on the autobiography of romance novelist, serial bride and matchmaker extraordinaire Dahlia Merchant (Delta Burke). Now with Dahlia's pledge to help her land a man within six months, Gwen begins testing the waters of romance once more. Ron Oliver directs this Hallmark Channel comedy that co-stars Gabriel Hogan.
link.title: synopsis
Nothing Too Good for a Cowboy
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
A Good Man Is Hard to Find

link.synopsis: As the 1991 Gulf War rages in the Middle East, another one plays out at an exclusive American prep school, and new student Josh Schuster (Jonah Rosenthal) ends up smack-dab in the middle of it in this dark indie comedy from director Adam Orman. What begins as a prank war mushrooms into something more serious as the students split along ethnic lines -- and as a Jew, Josh finds his balancing act between factions becoming that much trickier.
link.title: synopsis
Precious: Based on the Novel Push by Sapphire

link.synopsis: Comedian Artie Lange -- a "MADtv" alum and regular on "The Howard Stern Show" -- performs a brutally honest set of material in which he shares sidesplitting insights about professional athletes, drugs, political correctness, Afghanistan and more. Filmed in New York City, this live and uncensored comedy show features Lange at his best, offending and entertaining his audience at the very same time.
link.title: synopsis
Artie Lange: It's the Whiskey Talkin'
Meet the Creeps: Outrageous Hidden Camera Comedy
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Jackie "The Joke Man" Martling: A Safe Distance From Genius
Lisa Lampanelli: Long Live the Queen
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
I'm the One That I Want
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Carlos Mencia: The Best of "Funny Is Funny"
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam

link.synopsis: Clueless chums Lester (Chris Pratt) and Carl (Brendan Hines) enter a magical video booth and emerge as boys in an adult-themed babeland in this bawdy escape comedy. But Rod "Supercop" Cannon (Scott Caan) is on to them, and it's up to Autumn Bliss (Denise Richards) and her sorority brood to bail them out. Along the scenic route to self-discovery, the buds learn that there's more to Deep Valley than meets the eye.
link.title: synopsis
Bikini Chain Gang / Bikini Airways: Double Feature
The Good, the Bad and the Beautiful / The Bikini Academy
Freezer Burn: The Invasion of Laxdale
Futurama the Movie: Bender's Big Score

link.synopsis: London Betty (Nicole Lewis) finds herself a fish out of water when a reporting gig plunks her in a small American town. Betty's publisher, Maury (Daniel von Bargen), avoids her, grifting neighbor Billy (Thomas Edward Seymour) steals her pet bunny and Mayor Plumb (Dick Boland) is building a theme park in his yard. In this offbeat comedy, the absurdities pile up as Betty investigates Plumb and discovers in Billy the perfectly suited accomplice.
link.title: synopsis
Terry Fator: Live from Las Vegas
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
A Colbert Christmas: The Greatest Gift of All
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Live Comedy from the Laff House: Kevin Hart
National Lampoon Presents: Electric Apricot: Quest for Festeroo
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Zach Galifianakis: Live at the Purple Onion
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged)

link.synopsis: After surviving a devastating global epidemic, lonely virgin Robby finds himself hunted down by the only other survivors of the lethal virus -- impossibly hot women who have turned into blood-crazed, sex-obsessed vampires. Can Robby keep himself pure, or will he succumb to the lusty bloodsuckers and doom himself to their fate? Sean Skelding directs this ribald comedy that features a cameo by porn legend Ron Jeremy.
link.title: synopsis
Bikini Chain Gang / Bikini Airways: Double Feature
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
Lost Reality 2: More of the Worst

link.synopsis: Director Sebastian Doggart offers this genre-bending documentary that blends music and sly comedy to tell the tale of Devin Ratray, an actor (Home Alone) and musician who sets out to win the love of former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice. As he plots his path to her heart, Ratray writes love ballads, interviews Condi's real-life acquaintances and uncovers her disturbingly Machiavellian use of power during her tenure in office.
link.title: synopsis
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
Lucas Booth: Journey to the Unknown
A Colbert Christmas: The Greatest Gift of All
The Men Who Stare at Goats
The Buried Secrets of M. Night Shyamalan
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell
The Brady Bunch in the White House

link.synopsis: When they move to Israel to explore their Jewish heritage and revive their flagging marriage, fiftysomething French migrs Alain and Gisle Gaash (Grard Depardieu and Fanny Ardant) arrive in Tel Aviv to find their luggage lost, their apartment gone and Alain's new job taken. Now, as Alain struggles through this midlife crisis, Gisle finds herself attracted to a handsome young rabbi. Graham Guit directs this French romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
Jean de Florette / Manon of the Spring

link.synopsis: Dave Foley stars as Glenn in this comedy about five goofy but goodhearted guys working at a low-end electronics store in a boring strip mall. Glenn tries to motivate his crew with silly exercises, but this is one team that isn't worth building. As Avi seeks courage to face his arranged marriage, Rick looks for acting work, Jeff pursues Glenn's wife and Kyle copes with his father, all five guys learn about friendship, responsibility and teamwork.
link.title: synopsis
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
Live a Little, Love a Little

link.synopsis: Sibling rivalry fulfills its hilarious potential in this bittersweet comedy directed by indie favorite Bryan Poyser. After a lifetime of contention, brothers Rudy (Chris Doubek) and Paul (Alex Karpovsky) are further torn apart by their love for the same woman. Rudy has always felt betrayed by children's books author Paul, whom he believes is writing about their childhood, but jealously enters the picture when Paul begins dating Rudy's estranged wife.
link.title: synopsis
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Before the Devil Knows You're Dead

link.synopsis: This offbeat indie comedy tells the tale of John, a man who harbors a secret desire to cut off his arms. The bizarre wish becomes a darkly hilarious examination of the secrets we keep and the lengths we'll all go just to be happy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: In this low-budget indie comedy, Linas (Linas Phillips), attempting to heal the wounds of an ill-considered romance with a married woman, leaves Seattle in a tricked-out VW bus, bound for New York -- and maybe a little adventure. Phillips not only stars in the quirky cross-country odyssey, but also directs and co-wrote the script for this oddball road movie with fellow cast mates Davie-Blue and Jim Fletcher.
link.title: synopsis
The Wild and Wonderful Whites of West Virginia
How to Make Love to a Woman
I Knew It Was You: Rediscovering John Cazale

link.synopsis: Geeky loner Paul (Brendan Bradley) is so desperate to find love that he studies pretty women by secretly videotaping them. Though he succeeds in staging meetings with his dream girls, his lack of self-esteem hinders him -- till he encounters an artist named Esoterica. Their ardent romance soon transforms Paul, but Esoterica harbors a secret that may come between them. Peter Riegert plays Paul's fatherly boss in this charming romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Rick Steves: Austria and the Alps 2000-2009

link.synopsis: New Yorkers Kenny (Jefferson Brown) and Dagen (David Phillips) bite off more of the good life than they can chew when one falls in love with the daughter (Jordan Madley) of a mobster and the other hustles the ruthless crook out of a million bucks. Gambling with their lives, the pals must score big in a high-stakes poker game to get themselves in the clear. Dan Eisen directs this comedy that co-stars Vivica A. Fox and Corey Haim.
link.title: synopsis
South Beach Academy / Rock 'n' Roll High School Forever
A Good Man Is Hard to Find
Big Shot: Confessions of a Campus Bookie
Why Do Fools Fall in Love

link.synopsis: Fortune shines on penniless poet Nick Nero (Norman Reedus) and his musical collaborator Nick Beat (Mark Boone Junior) when they find a mysterious box that produces beautiful rhythms. But while trying to score a paying gig, Nero lands in hot water by cavorting with a club owner's wife (lodie Bouchez). Eric Roberts, Patrick Bauchau and Jon Gries co-star in this trippy comedy about love, friendship and success.
link.title: synopsis
Masters of Horror: John Carpenter: Cigarette Burns
One Week from a Man's Life

link.synopsis: The life of flight attendant Summer Pozzi (Lara Phillips) hits some turbulence when she's suddenly transferred to San Francisco, far away from her family and her boyfriend. There, she rebuilds her life and woos handsome Capt. Julian (Josh Randall). Michael Gilio, Claire Rankin and Rachel Luttrell co-star as Summer's nutty new roommates in this high-flying indie comedy co-written by former flight attendant Silver Tree.
link.title: synopsis
The Awful Truth with Michael Moore
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Are You Being Served?: The Movie
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People

link.synopsis: The Vacationeers comedy troupe unleashes feature-length laughs with this quirky flick about a group of crime scene videographers who take it upon themselves to catch a hipster-hunting serial killer on the loose. Set on the streets of Los Angeles's east side, the film boasts a soundtrack peppered with songs from local music acts and also offers up little-known facts about the neighborhood and its history.
link.title: synopsis
A Film with Me in It
Assassination of a High School President

link.synopsis: When his reckless brother, Abel (Asier Etxeandia), refuses to man up and take responsibility for getting young Muslim beauty Aisha (Nur Al Levi) pregnant, bashful Spanish butcher Cain (Javier Cifrin) agrees to marry the girl and act as the child's father. But the simple plan goes haywire when Cain discovers he must first adopt Aisha's Islamic faith as his own. This charming comedy from director Fernando Colomo co-stars Ash Varrez.
link.title: synopsis
R2: Y el Caso del Cadaver Sin Cabeza
El Penalti Mas Largo Del Mundo
Blue Eyes of the Broken Doll

link.synopsis: On the Korean peninsula in the seventh century, Gen. Kye Baek (Joong-hoon Park) leads the massively outmanned forces of the Baekche kingdom against a double invasion by the Shilla kingdom and the Chinese Tang naval forces -- and it's all quite funny. This Monty Python-esque take on the famed Battle of Hwangsanbul features plenty of physical comedy, clever wordplay and sharp satire amid the many exciting battle scenes.
link.title: synopsis
Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War
Three Kingdoms: Resurrection of the Dragon
The Messenger: The Story of Joan of Arc

title.regular: Once Upon a Time in the Battlefield
title.short: Once Upon a Time in the Battlefield

link.synopsis: In this Hindi-language comedy (a remake of the Malayalam film Vettom), lovesick friends Nitin (Akshay Kumar) and Ram (Sunil Shetty) come up with a plan to get rich quick and marry their sweethearts (Katrina Kaif and Sameera Reddy) by dog-napping a wealthy woman's (Archana Puran Singh) pooch and holding it for ransom. But when the dog scampers away, the cops assume that Nitin is the one who needs rescuing. Suddenly, Ram is a wanted man.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Outspoken &NFi;Vice&NFi_; magazine founder Gavin McInnes delivers an unapologetic collection of every comedy skit he's ever done in this crass compilation that also features celebrity appearances by Bill Maher, Carson Daly, Fred Armisen and Deborah Harry. Actress Natasha Lyonne also stops by for a few laughs and watches footage of her younger self as one of the kids in the Playhouse Gang on "Pee-wee's Playhouse."
link.title: synopsis
Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home
Film Crew: Wild Women of Wongo
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Chesterfield Kings: Where is the Chesterfield King?

title.regular: Gavin McInnes Is a F**king A**hole
title.short: Gavin McInnes Is a F**king A**hole

link.synopsis: Told in flashback, this pitch-black Korean comedy begins with the funeral of 17-year-old Hee-Joon, an aspiring writer. But a trio of family members in attendance is more concerned with tearing each other to shreds than with honoring the deceased. Dad (Ha-bok Yu) is a school coach with an unhealthy affinity for male students, Mom (Myeong-shin Park) is an exacting literature teacher, and daughter Uami (Byeol Kim) has a fondness for taxidermy.
link.title: synopsis
Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
The Legend of the Shadowless Sword

link.synopsis: This delightful comedy focuses on three friends who travel through Texas together on the way to the gallery opening of photographer Rose (Arianne Martin). Rose is accompanied by her pal, Alex, for whom she secretly yearns, and her ex-con brother, Jamie. While Rose and Alex finally move from friendship to romance, Jamie revels in his new freedom. The trio encounters an amusing array of oddballs as they learn about life, themselves and one another.
link.title: synopsis
The Perfect Age of Rock 'n' Roll

link.synopsis: Buttoned-down James Stein (Danny Cymbal) plays it straight as a number cruncher for the International Advisory Board, but with conformity and a pallid home life sapping his spirit, Stein turns an assignment to audit a war profiteer into a prime growth opportunity. The road to success is paved with humiliation, hit men and money-hungry harlots, and Stein's principles aren't the only thing hanging in the balance in this indie black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
